name: expand
title: Value Set Expansion
description: The definition of a value set is used to create a simple collection of codes suitable for use for data entry or validation. This operation retrieves a collection of concepts from the value set, optionally filtered by supplied parameters.
comment: The result of this operation is a resource of type ValueSet, which contains an expansion of the value set. If the server is unable to fully expand the value set, it returns an error with an OperationOutcome.

parameter.name: url
parameter.documentation: A canonical reference to a value set. The server must know the value set (e.g. it is defined explicitly in the server's value sets, or it is defined implicitly by some code system known to the server).

parameter.name: valueSet
parameter.documentation: The value set is provided directly as part of the request. Servers may choose not to accept value sets in this fashion.

parameter.name: valueSetVersion
parameter.documentation: The identifier that is used to identify a specific version of the value set to be used when generating the expansion. This is an arbitrary value managed by the value set author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if value sets are updated daily or it might be a version number.

parameter.name: context
parameter.documentation: The context of the value set, so that the server can resolve this to a value set to expand. The context is a canonical URL that identifies a ContextAware Value Set definition.

parameter.name: contextDirection
parameter.documentation: If a context is provided, a context direction may also be provided. Valid values are 'incoming' and 'outgoing'.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.documentation: A text filter that is applied to display names of concepts in the value set. This is a "contains" search. The server applies the filter based on its own rules. The server may also search on designations, codes, and properties. The filter may also be a regular expression, if the server supports it.

parameter.name: date
parameter.documentation: The date for which the expansion should be generated.  If a date is provided, it must be in the YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.documentation: Paging support - where to start if a subset is desired (default = 0). The server trims the structure of the expanded value set to only include concepts starting at the specified offset.

parameter.name: count
parameter.documentation: Paging support - the number of records to return, if a subset is desired (default = 1000). The server trims the structure of the expanded value set to only include concepts starting at the specified offset.

parameter.name: includeDefinition
parameter.documentation: Whether to include the definition of the value set in the output. If this is true, the value set resource returned will include the definition of the value set.

parameter.name: activeOnly
parameter.documentation: Specifies whether to include inactive concepts in the expansion. If this is true, the expansion will only include active concepts.

parameter.name: excludeNested
parameter.documentation: Nested codesystems are not expanded, where the value set is defined recursively. If this is true, the expansion will not include nested codesystems.

parameter.name: excludeNotForUI
parameter.documentation: Whether to exclude concepts that are not intended for user interface presentation. This is based on the [not-for-ui](extension-codesystem-not-for-ui.html) extension.

parameter.name: excludePostCoordinated
parameter.documentation: Whether to exclude concepts that are post-coordinated. This is based on the [post-coordinated](extension-codesystem-post-coordinated.html) extension.

parameter.name: displayLanguage
parameter.documentation: Specifies the language to be used for display names for German, French and English.

parameter.name: excludeSystem
parameter.documentation: A system to exclude from the expansion. This can be used to exclude whole code systems from the expansion.

parameter.name: property
parameter.documentation: A property to return in the expansion, if the client wishes to receive them. If no properties are specified, the server SHOULD not return any properties. This is a key to control the inclusion of properties in the expansion.

parameter.name: return
parameter.documentation: The result of the expansion. The expansion is returned as a ValueSet resource.

name: lookup
title: Concept Look Up
description: Given a code/system, or a Coding, get additional details about the concept.

parameter.name: code
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be located. If a code is provided, a system must be provided

parameter.name: system
parameter.documentation: The system for the code that is to be located

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version of the system, if one was provided in the source data

parameter.name: coding
parameter.documentation: A coding to look up

parameter.name: date
parameter.documentation: The date for which the information should be returned. If no date is supplied, the server should return the information that is current.

parameter.name: displayLanguage
parameter.documentation: The requested language for display strings.

parameter.name: property
parameter.documentation: A property that the client wishes to be returned in the output. If no properties are specified, the server SHOULD return all properties. For the definitions of the properties available, see the CodeSystem resource.

parameter.name: name
parameter.documentation: A display name for the code system

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version that has been used to look up the code.

parameter.name: display
parameter.documentation: The preferred display for the code.

parameter.name: designation
parameter.documentation: Additional representations for the code.

parameter.name: property
parameter.documentation: Properties of the concept.

name: validate-code
title: Value Set based Validation
description: Validate that a coded value is in a value set.

parameter.name: url
parameter.documentation: Value set Canonical URL. The server must know the value set (e.g. it is defined explicitly in the server's value sets, or it is defined implicitly by some code system known to the server).

parameter.name: valueSet
parameter.documentation: The value set is provided directly as part of the request. Servers may choose not to accept value sets in this fashion

parameter.name: code
parameter.documentation: The code to be validated. If a code is provided, a system must be provided.

parameter.name: system
parameter.documentation: The system for the code.

parameter.name: systemVersion
parameter.documentation: The version of the system.

parameter.name: display
parameter.documentation: The display associated with the code, if known.

parameter.name: coding
parameter.documentation: A coding to be validated. The system must be populated.

parameter.name: codeableConcept
parameter.documentation: A codeable concept to be validated. The server will validate each coding in the codeable concept.

parameter.name: date
parameter.documentation: The date for which the validation should be performed.

parameter.name: abstract
parameter.documentation: If true, the validation will fail if the code is abstract. If false, the validation will pass if the code is abstract. If not provided, the server's default behavior is used.

parameter.name: displayLanguage
parameter.documentation: The language in which the display name of the code should be returned.

parameter.name: result
parameter.documentation: True if the concept is in the value set.

parameter.name: message
parameter.documentation: Error details, if result = false. If this is provided when result = true, it carries hints and warnings.

parameter.name: display
parameter.documentation: The display for the code, if the system can determine it.

name: subsumes
title: Subsumption Testing
description: Test if a code subsumes another code (e.g. if it is a super-concept of the other code).

parameter.name: codeA
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be tested as a subsumer.

parameter.name: codeB
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be tested as a subsumee.

parameter.name: system
parameter.documentation: The code system in which the subsumption test will be performed.

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version of the code system, if one was provided in the source data.

parameter.name: codingA
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be tested as a subsumer.

parameter.name: codingB
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be tested as a subsumee.

parameter.name: outcome
parameter.documentation: The outcome of the subsumption test.

name: translate
title: Concept Translation
description: Translate a code from one value set to another, based on the existing ConceptMap resources.

parameter.name: url
parameter.documentation: A canonical URL for a ConceptMap.

parameter.name: conceptMap
parameter.documentation: The concept map is provided directly as a parameter.

parameter.name: conceptMapVersion
parameter.documentation: The version of the concept map to use.

parameter.name: code
parameter.documentation: The code to translate.

parameter.name: system
parameter.documentation: The system for the code.

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version of the system.

parameter.name: sourceScope
parameter.documentation: A value set from which the concept to be translated is coming.

parameter.name: coding
parameter.documentation: A coding to translate.

parameter.name: codeableConcept
parameter.documentation: A codeable concept to translate.

parameter.name: targetScope
parameter.documentation: A value set in which the translated code should be.

parameter.name: dependency
parameter.documentation: Another element that may be used to determine the outcome of the mapping.

parameter.name: product
parameter.documentation: Another element that may be used to determine the outcome of the mapping.

parameter.name: reverse
parameter.documentation: If true, the mapping is reversed.

parameter.name: result
parameter.documentation: True if the translation was successful.

parameter.name: message
parameter.documentation: Error details, if result = false.

parameter.name: match
parameter.documentation: A concept map relationship between the source and target concepts.

name: closure
title: Closure Table Maintenance
description: This operation provides support for ongoing maintenance of a client-side transitive closure table.

parameter.name: name
parameter.documentation: The name that defines the particular context for the subsumption based closure table.

parameter.name: concept
parameter.documentation: A list of concepts to add to the closure table.

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: A request to update the closure table.

parameter.name: map
parameter.documentation: A concept map with the transitive closure for the given concepts.
